Controlling System Tray Notification

With this application, you can learn about items that affect you by looking at the system tray. The application notifies you when:

  • A change request becomes your responsibility.

  • Any field for a requirement or task that is your responsibility has changed.

  • Any field for a topic that lists you as a recipient has changed. (If a topic has no recipients listed, no one receives notification.)

Defect icons, Requirement icons, Topic icons, or Task icons display in your workstation's system tray when one of the events described above occurs. Double-clicking these icons opens the <project>:New <item type> dialog, which lists the items that need your attention.

Double-clicking an item displays its properties. After you have opened and reviewed the item, it disappears from the dialog. You may find it desirable to take notes while looking at the item.

Note: If your administrator has enabled e-mail notification, you will automatically receive an e-mail message about the events listed above. E-mail notification is client independent, and you do not need to run the application to receive these notifications. System tray notification can be used with or without e-mail notification, however.

To control system tray notification:

  1. Select Tools > Personal Options. The Personal Options dialog opens.

  2. Select the Change Request, Requirement, Task, or Topic tab.

  3. To be notified about items for which you are responsible or topics for which you are a recipient, select the Check for new or modified change requests (or requirements, topics or tasks) every __ minutes check box.

  4. Enter the time interval to be used between checks. The default is 10 minutes.

  5. Repeat steps 2-4 for each type of item for which you want system tray notification.

  6. Click OK to save your options, and close the Personal Options dialog.
